content.description:
Starts in obvious pockets, center of face, then climbs left (right of tree).  At roof shoot right hand up to one hell of a hueco, work your feet up to pull the roof with a final daring foot and stand up .  You have completed the first 15 ft, now continue to scramble on v-easy climbing to the top. walk off is left towards LP Wall 

  the tree is off.
content.protection: A good amount of crash pads.

content.location: On the Bae Wall, start with 2 hand holds with obvious white striped markings.

content.description: Fun two handed dyno! Use the lower holds of Bae wall direct to jump to the scoop at the top of the beginning of the roof instead of heading into the crack.Â
content.protection: A few pads easy to swing out

content.description: The top of Bae Wall was cleaned off to allow the direct line on the Bae wall to be done. Use the two pockets where the face and the bottom of the roof meet before pulling through some washed out bowls above. Celebrate when you find the huge rail a few feet above the roof.
content.location: Direct line on the Bae Wall. Follow directions in the area description

content.description:
Named for the graffiti on the wall resembling Bae, this boulder tends to be dry and warm as it gets sun most of the day.  A clear cut face up to an astounding roof makes this a fun area to climb.  

  There is potential for three routes on this boulder .  One which has been sent is called Hangman and climbs left then pulls the roof using the high quality jug dead center on the roof.  

  A direct route which has not been sent goes straight up the center of the face to the jug over the roof and another undone problem would climb right and over the roof.
